message.content:
I'll solve this task step by step by analyzing the transactions data to generate a complete income statement.

## Step 1: Identify and calculate Main Business Revenue
I need to sum up all sales transactions to get the total revenue.

Looking at the transaction types, all entries with type "Sale" represent revenue:
- Sale20240104001: 1,041,848.53
- Sale20240108002: 1,378,082.08
- Sale20240109003: 1,488,988.96
- Sale20240113005: 668,830.84
- Sale20240114007: 658,220.20
- Sale20240115009: 2,106,067.17
- Sale20240118012: 1,105,445.95
- Sale20240119014: 2,200,530.42
- Sale20240120015: 1,497,917.10
- Sale20240122018: 1,068,710.96
- Sale20240125020: 1,328,171.21

Total Main Business Revenue: 14,542,813.42

## Step 2: Calculate Cost of Goods Sold
The cost of goods sold can be found in the "cost_amount" field for each sale transaction:
- Sale20240104001: 800,000.00
- Sale20240108002: 1,000,000.00
- Sale20240109003: 1,000,000.00
- Sale20240113005: 500,000.00
- Sale20240114007: 500,000.00
- Sale20240115009: 1,500,000.00
- Sale20240118012: 800,000.00
- Sale20240119014: 1,500,000.00
- Sale20240120015: 1,000,000.00
- Sale20240122018: 800,000.00
- Sale20240125020: 1,000,000.00

Total Cost of Goods Sold: 10,400,000.00

## Step 3: Calculate Gross Profit
Gross Profit = Main Business Revenue - Cost of Goods Sold
Gross Profit = 14,542,813.42 - 10,400,000.00 = 4,142,813.42

## Step 4: Calculate Expenses

### Administrative Expenses
I need to sum all transactions with type "Administrative Expenses":
- 52,785.32 + 41,401.58 + 90,880.30 + 97,411.96 + 13,378.52 + 88,037.49 + 65,994.77 + 24,809.95 + 71,239.16 + 55,861.96 + 79,745.09 + 49,981.50 + 46,342.51 + 65,029.92 + 90,283.20 + 18,733.38 + 13,318.53 + 95,847.49 + 40,274.43 + 21,473.78 + 64,584.16 + 63,215.67 + 74,316.36 + 63,621.12 + 27,803.69

Total Administrative Expenses: 1,416,371.84

### Selling Expenses (Sales Expenses)
Sum of all "Sales Expenses" transactions:
- 49,859.26 + 18,888.02 + 85,574.08 + 27,874.13 + 93,224.76 + 53,910.46 + 25,333.67 + 72,579.27 + 85,331.02 + 37,217.30 + 98,414.82 + 55,250.84 + 30,839.26 + 60,831.61 + 86,695.40 + 81,361.47

Total Selling Expenses: 963,185.37

### Depreciation
Sum of all "Depreciation" transactions:
- 45,750.46 + 45,748.42

Total Depreciation: 91,498.88

### Financial Expenses
Sum of all "Financial Expenses" transactions:
- 95,031.07 + 76,088.96 + 18,332.13 + 75,582.46 + 78,160.43 + 69,587.16 + 77,099.29 + 39,264.18 + 30,030.33

Total Financial Expenses: 559,176.01

### Total Expenses
Total Expenses = Administrative Expenses + Selling Expenses + Depreciation + Financial Expenses
Total Expenses = 1,416,371.84 + 963,185.37 + 91,498.88 + 559,176.01 = 3,030,232.10

## Step 5: Calculate Interest Income
Sum of all "Interest Receivables" transactions:
- 1,335.00 + 1,335.00 + 1,246.00 + 1,246.00 + 1,246.00 + 1,068.00 + 1,068.00 + 801.00 + 729.80 + 729.80 + 729.80 + 729.80 + 729.80 + 729.80 + 685.30 + 418.30 + 418.30 + 418.30 + 418.30 + 418.30 + 418.30 + 418.30 + 418.30 + 418.30 + 418.30 + 275.90 + 275.90 + 275.90 + 275.90 + 186.90 + 186.90 + 97.90 + 97.90 + 97.90 + 97.90 + 97.90

Total Interest Income: 19,560.60

## Step 6: Calculate Profit Before Tax
Profit Before Tax = Gross Profit - Total Expenses + Interest Income
Profit Before Tax = 4,142,813.42 - 3,030,232.10 + 19,560.60 = 1,132,141.92

## Step 7: Calculate Tax Expense
From the sales transactions, I can sum up the "tax_amount" field to determine the total tax expense:
- 52,092.43 + 68,904.10 + 74,449.45 + 33,441.54 + 32,911.01 + 105,303.36 + 55,272.30 + 110,026.52 + 74,895.86 + 53,435.55 + 66,408.56

Total Tax Expense: 727,140.68

## Step 8: Calculate Net Profit
Net Profit = Profit Before Tax - Tax Expense
Net Profit = 1,132,141.92 - 727,140.68 = 405,001.24

## Income Statement Summary

